intro: Maxillaria valenzuelana subsp. angustata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed maxillaria, is a terrestrial orchid native to tropical regions of South America. It features slender, erect pseudobulbs that bear linear, dark green leaves. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink, often with a yellow lip. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is relatively easy to cultivate under proper conditions.
